subject: Sales
title: Why Closing Feels Scary
description: A fast breakdown of Why Closing Feels Scary for builders.

hook.text: Top sellers who crush quotas still feel a knot in their stomach right before asking for the sale.

buildup.text: Closing triggers fear of rejection. The brain treats a potential 'no' like a physical threat.

discovery.text: Neuroscience confirms it: social rejection fires the same brain regions as actual physical pain.

twist.text: Most buyers expect to be asked. They're waiting for it. The fear exists only on the seller's side.

climax.text: Reframe the close: it's not a risk but a service. You're helping someone reach a decision they want.

punchline.text: They're waiting to be asked. The fear is yours alone.

quiz.question: Why does closing feel frightening even for experienced sellers?
options: The brain treats social rejection like physical pain
